definition: state official or subject in dynastic China/I, your servant (used in addressing the sovereign)/Kangxi radical 131

sentences.english: A king who exercises his authority over his subjects is quite acceptable.
sentences.chinese: 国王施威于臣民是完全可以接受的一种情形。

sentences.english: They are heaping chain on chain around the limbs of their subjects.
sentences.chinese: 他们在自己臣民的手脚上套上更多的锁链。

sentences.english: King Hamad bin Isa Al Khalifa of Bahrain tried pacifying his subjects with cash.
sentences.chinese: 巴林国王萨勒曼试图用金钱安抚他的臣民。

sentences.english: The King ruled his people well and wisely.
sentences.chinese: 这位国王贤明地统治着他的臣民。

sentences.english: Sir, there is a bond made between a king and his people.
sentences.chinese: 先生，在一国之王和他的臣民之间，存在一个契约。

sentences.english: The conqueror governed his new subjects with an iron scepter .
sentences.chinese: 征服者以铁腕统治其新臣民。

sentences.english: Then, with all my subjects gone, I would no longer be the king of flunkeys.
sentences.chinese: 我将没有一个臣民，我将不再是奴才们的君主。

sentences.english: How long will I endure the insincere prayers of your spineless subjects?
sentences.chinese: 我忍受你那些没种的臣民虚假的祷告，要到几时呢？

sentences.english: To get their own bread they must overdose the king's lieges .
sentences.chinese: 为了多挣一些钱，他们不惜对英王的臣民用药过量。

sentences.english: The king's subjects protested against his imperialism.
sentences.chinese: 国王的臣民反对他的帝制。

sentences.english: The biggest honor is to be people of the highest king.
sentences.chinese: 作万王之王的臣民，是最大的殊荣。

sentences.english: All his subjects had to bow before it.
sentences.chinese: 所有他的臣民都要在金像前俯伏敬拜。

sentences.english: The kings and queen of Scotland themselves shared their people's enthusiasm for playing games.
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰的国王及王后和他们的臣民一样热衷体育。

sentences.english: They were subjects of a feudal ruler.
sentences.chinese: 他们是封建统治者的臣民。

sentences.english: Welshmen shall do the same to us and ours.
sentences.chinese: 威尔士人对于我们及我们的臣民，亦应同样对待。

definition: former kings/former emperors/in Confucian writing, refers esp. to the sage rulers Yao 堯|尧[Yao2], Shun 舜[Shun4], Yu 禹[Yu3], Tang 湯|汤[Tang1] and the kings of Zhou
the (rightful) emperor/"Son of Heaven" (traditional English translation)
